newsitem.title: USA: Caterpillar confirms Big Smith court ruling.
newsitem.headline: Caterpillar confirms Big Smith court ruling.

text.p: Caterpillar Inc confirmed Wednesday that the U.S. District Court in Peoria ruled that it had properly terminated a licensing agreement with Big Smith Brands Inc.
Caterpillar, a heavy-equipment maker, claimed that Big Smith, which makes specialty apparel such as overalls, jeans and jackets, breached its licensing agreement.

The dispute stemmed from Caterpillar's requirement that trademark licensees obtain manufacturer's agreements so that Caterpillar can maintain quality control standards over third-party manufacturers, the company said.
Earlier, Big Smith said the court ruled in favor of Caterpillar and dismissed Big Smith's motion for a preliminary injunction against Caterpillar.
Big Smith said it was holding talks with Caterpillar to try to resolve remaining issues amicably.
Caterpillar has licensed merchandise for sale under its trademark for more than 40 years, it said.
